sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1:
Let A = {1,2,3} and B = {2,3,4}. Find: 

(i) (A x B) △ B 

(ii) A x (B △ B) 

(iii) Compare the results of (i) and (ii) and prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
